name: post-payments-paymentPspReference-reversals
description:
[Refunds](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/CheckoutService/latest/post/payments/{paymentPspReference}/refunds) a payment if it has already been captured, and [cancels](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/CheckoutService/latest/post/payments/{paymentPspReference}/cancels) a payment if it has not yet been captured. Returns a unique reference for this request. You get the outcome of the request asynchronously, in a [**CANCEL_OR_REFUND** webhook](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/reverse#cancel-or-refund-webhook).

The reversed amount is always the full payment amount.
> Do not use this request for payments that involve multiple partial captures.

For more information, refer to [Reversal](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/reversal).

paymentPspReference.description: The [`pspReference`](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/CheckoutService/latest/post/payments__resParam_pspReference) of the payment that you want to reverse.

Idempotency-Key.description: A unique identifier for the message with a maximum of 64 characters (we recommend a UUID).

merchantAccount.description: The merchant account that is used to process the payment.

reference.description: Your reference for the reversal request. Maximum length: 80 characters.

name.description: Name of the field. For example, Name of External Platform.

version.description: Version of the field. For example, Version of External Platform.

os.description: Operating system running on the merchant device.

locale.description: Locale on the shopper interaction device.
